articles.description: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi vowed to repeatedly “hit the button” on economic growth and adopt a bolder diplomatic stance without spooking markets during a speech setting out her policy vision.

articles.title: Tech Stock Selloff Looks Overdone, Australian Pension CIO Says
articles.description: The chief investment officer of UniSuper, one of Australia’s largest pension funds, is brushing aside concerns about the downturn in global tech stocks, saying that spending in the sector can support other parts of the market.

articles.title: Ali Partovi’s Neo looks to upend the accelerator model with low-dilution terms
articles.description: Neo's new Residency program invests $750,000 in an uncapped SAFE for startups and provides a $40,000 no-strings-attached grant for college students.

articles.title: Social media companies face legal reckoning over mental health harms to children

articles.title: Amid extortion crisis, Surrey police has proposed budget increase slashed
articles.description: The City of Surrey says on Thursday that it has greenlit a $284.5 million budget for the Surrey Police Service (SPS), an increased allowance of $45 million compared to last year’s budget.
